articles.title: Why a 70:30 India-global portfolio makes sense in a changing world, Subho Moulik decodes

articles.title: F&O Talk | Nifty cracks 5% in 11 days: Is this just the beginning of a deeper slide? Sudeep Shah weighs in

PSU banks are outperforming private peers.

articles.title: Sensex and Nifty edge modestly higher on easing geopolitical jitters

Gains in Asian markets and easing geopolitical tensions provided some support, but persistent foreign fund outflows and mixed corporate results maintained investor caution.

articles.title: Why New Delhi isn’t losing sleep over the rupee
articles.summary: The Indian rupee is falling as foreign investors withdraw funds and the RBI sells dollars. A trade deal with the US could reverse this trend. India's economy is strong and can absorb higher import costs. The US focus on tariffs may keep oil prices low, aiding India's growth. Washington will eventually reconsider its tariff policy, benefiting the rupee.

articles.title: View: India is cornered by China’s lock on tech

This impacts key sectors like electric vehicles and energy storage, affecting major Indian conglomerates. Despite recent diplomatic overtures, Beijing's stance highlights a significant technology gap. India's 'Make in India' initiative struggles against this dominance.

articles.title: Sensex falls over 300 pts, Nifty below 25,500 amid trade worries and foreign selling

Investors are closely monitoring global trade uncertainties and ongoing foreign fund outflows, while the quarterly earnings season also captures market attention. The Sensex dropped over 300 points, and the Nifty 50 fell more than 90 points.

articles.summary: The fastest-selling game console of all time may not be enough to shelter Nintendo Co.’s stock from growing investor fears about skyrocketing memory prices.

articles.summary: The survey says digital addiction is hurting academic and work performance, and impacting youth mental health, due to distractions, sleep loss, and reduced focus.

articles.title: 'He shared everything with me': Fadnavis rubbishes speculations over merger of NCP after Ajit Pawar's death
articles.summary: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis expressed surprise regarding any potential merger talks between NCP factions, stating Ajit Pawar always confided in him. This follows Sharad Pawar's claim that Ajit Pawar had set February 12 for a merger announcement. Ajit Pawar's wife, Sunetra Pawar, was recently sworn in as Deputy CM.

articles.title: Amazon in talks to invest as much as $50 billion in OpenAI: Report
articles.summary: OpenAI is looking to raise up to $100 billion in funding, valuing it at about $830 billion, Reuters reported on Tuesday. SoftBank Group is in talks to invest as much as an additional $30 billion in the startup.

articles.summary: Himachal Merchant Navy officer held on US-seized tanker returns home after 20 days

articles.summary: Sunetra Pawar becomes Maharashtra’s first woman Deputy Chief Minister; know about her journey in politics, business, education and environment.

articles.summary: Fresh off a $28 million Series B raise, Unbox Robotics is sharpening its focus on expanding warehouse automation deployments in Europe and the US, while calling on Budget 2026 to boost robotics adoption through capex incentives, stronger R D support, and ESOP tax relief.

articles.summary: SpaceX seeks FCC approval to launch 1 million satellites as solar-powered orbital data centers for AI, aiming for a Kardashev II civilization and exploring mergers with xAI or Tesla Inc.

Additionally, the government is extending the timelines for exporters in the leather and textile sectors, allowing for improved financial management and reduced uncertainties.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Customs levy on personal imports halved to 10%; high-end electronic goods, apparel may see lower landed costs
articles.summary: The government has also signalled higher duty-free allowances for Indians returning from overseas travel, potentially widening the benefit for frequent flyers and international shoppers. The move could drop the landed cost of everything — from electronics to fashion — that customers import privately, mostly because they are unavailable in India or would be launched later, industry executives said.

articles.summary: A federal judge signaled on Friday she may dismiss ‍a lawsuit by Elon Musk's ​artificial intelligence startup xAI accusing Sam Altman's rival OpenAI ⁠of stealing trade secrets to gain an unfair advantage in developing AI technology.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Making India attractive hub for sustained investment
articles.summary: India's 2026 budget focuses on predictable growth. It aims to attract global investment with clear tax rules for technology and data centers. Manufacturing in critical areas like defense and advanced electronics is also a priority. Reforms simplify business operations. This strategy positions India for long-term growth and a key role in global supply chains.

articles.summary: Nvidia's plan to invest up to $100 ​billion in OpenAI to help it train and ⁠run its latest artificial-intelligence models has stalled after some inside the chip giant expressed doubts about the deal.

articles.title: Industry leaders welcome Budget push for healthcare, manufacturing & deeptech as India moves towards self-reliant future
articles.summary: The Budget aims to create a balance between India’s agrarian roots and its deeptech ecosystem by prioritising future-ready infrastructure, say industry leaders.

articles.summary: More money, stronger policing: Budget 2026 boosts Delhi Police's operational muscle

articles.title: Nvidia halts plan to invest $100 billion in OpenAI, WSJ says
articles.summary: Nvidia's talks to invest up to 100 billion dollars in OpenAI stalled, raising doubts about their AI partnership. Amazon.com Inc. may invest 50 billion dollars in OpenAI's funding round.

articles.title: India's space budget inches up in 2026-27, capital spend rises but ambition outpaces funding
articles.summary: India’s 2026–27 space budget rises modestly, prioritising capital spending, Gaganyaan, satellites and commercialisation, but raises questions on adequacy as ambitions expand in coming high-cost missions.

articles.summary: Budget 2026: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman presented her ninth consecutive budget.

articles.summary: The development came shortly after Sitharaman ended her much-anticipated Union Budget speech in Parliament.

articles.title: Tectone Loses Civil Court Case Filed by Ex-Girlfriend Pinkchyu in Texas
articles.summary: Streamer Tectone has lost a civil protective order case filed by his ex-girlfriend Pinkchyu. A Texas court granted Pinkchyu a 10-year protective order against Tectone. The order restricts contact and requires Tectone to maintain distance. This civil ruling does not involve criminal charges. Tectone publicly acknowledged the outcome, noting the difference in civil proceedings.

articles.title: Economic Survey 2026 flags high distribution costs as key drag on insurance penetration
articles.summary: The Economic Survey 2025–26 warns high distribution costs are limiting India’s insurance growth, causing low penetration despite rising premiums and density, and urges digitisation to boost inclusion.

articles.title: Meet Moltbook: The social network where AI assistants talk to each other
articles.summary: The platform created by developer Matt Schlicht, has given most of the control to an AI assistant that moderates posts and removes spam.

articles.title: Personal income tax grows twice as fast as corporate tax in India
articles.summary: Despite tax relief, personal income tax will outpace corporate taxes, driven by rapid base expansion, compliance, and technology-led administration, cementing individuals as India’s largest contributor.

articles.title: SIP inflows jump seven-fold over past decade; household savings shift towards mutual funds: Economic Survey
articles.summary: Economic Survey 2025-26: SIPs boost mutual fund growth in India, assets reach ₹80 lakh crore, 5.9 crore investors shift savings to equities.

articles.title: UAE praises India-EU FTA, calls it significant step towards economic openness and sustainable growth
articles.summary: The United Arab Emirates has welcomed the free trade agreement reached between India and the EU, describing it as a significant step towards promoting "economic openness" and supporting "sustainable growth".

articles.title: Budget’s focus on skilling healthcare professionals a big plus: Dr Harsh Mahajan, FICCI
Union Budget: Textiles, leather, seafood gain in big export focus
articles.summary: Nirmala Sitharaman announced duty concessions to help India develop global manufacturing prowess by establishing economical and reliable supply chains

articles.title: X down for thousands of US users, Downdetector data finds
articles.summary: There were ​more than ​19,281 reports of ‌issues ‍with ‍the social media platform formerly ‌known as Twitter, as of 11:19 a.m. ET, according ‍to Downdetector, which tracks ‍outages by ⁠collating ⁠status reports from a number of sources.

articles.title: Content economy gets a push in Budget 2026, industry says creator labs will improve talent supply
articles.summary: Gaming and animation startup founders from the sector — which is also called the `Orange Economy’ — told ET that early exposure at the school and college level could familiarise students with industry tools, workflows, and creative thinking. This in turn will improve their employability and ease hiring pressures as companies scale.

articles.title: India hands Apple a win by letting foreign firms fund equipment without tax risk
articles.summary: Apple has been growing in India in recent years as it diversifies beyond China. Counterpoint Research says iPhone's share of the ‌Indian market has doubled ‌to 8% since 2022. And while China still accounts for 75% of global iPhone shipments, India's share has quadrupled to 25% since 2022.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Gaming industry welcomes proposal for creator labs in schools, colleges
articles.summary: FM Sitharaman proposed government support for the Indian Institute of Creative Technologies (IICT), Mumbai, to set up animation, visual effects, gaming, and comics (AVGC) creator labs in 15,000 secondary schools and 500 colleges across the country.

articles.title: UPI transactions hit record high of Rs 28.33 lakh crore in January
articles.summary: Unified Payments Interface (UPI) transactions hit a new high in January. Value crossed Rs 28.33 lakh crore. Volume reached 21.70 billion transactions. This shows strong growth from the previous month. Daily transactions averaged 700 million. This digital payment system continues its impressive expansion across India.

articles.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang denies he is unhappy with OpenAI, says 'huge' investment planned
articles.summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said the company plans to make a “huge” investment in OpenAI, likely its largest ever, denying reports of unhappiness with the ChatGPT maker. The chipmaker had previously announced a potential $100 billion investment to help OpenAI access advanced chips. The Wall Street Journal said some internal doubts had stalled the deal.

articles.title: Groww among bidders for Prudential’s India asset management firm
articles.summary: Prudential Financial’s India asset management arm has attracted takeover interest from at least two domestic firms, people familiar with the matter said. Groww and Edelweiss have submitted bids for the loss-making unit, though talks are ongoing. PGIM’s India business has struggled to scale since its Deutsche Bank acquisition.

articles.title: Delhivery chairman Deepak Kapoor, independent director Saugata Gupta resign from board
articles.summary: Delhivery chairman and independent director Deepak Kapoor has stepped down from the board with effect from April 1 as part of a planned reshuffle. Independent director Saugata Gupta has also resigned. Kapoor led the board for eight years, including during Delhivery’s 2022 stock market listing.

articles.title: Instagram tests feature to let users quietly leave ‘Close Friends’ lists: Report
articles.summary: The new feature is still in the works, and no launch date has been set. The Close Friends feature, rolled out in 2018, enables users to share stories, reels, and posts with a selected group of followers.

articles.title: Apple loses more AI researchers and a Siri executive in latest departure
articles.summary: Apple has lost at least four more of its artificial intelligence researchers in recent weeks in addition to a top Siri executive, with the staff headed to employers such as Meta Platforms and Google DeepMind.

articles.title: Former Google engineer convicted in AI espionage case
articles.summary: A federal jury in San Francisco has convicted a former Google software engineer of stealing sensitive artificial intelligence trade secrets for the benefit of China, marking the first-ever conviction on AI-related economic espionage charges, US officials said.

articles.title: Google cofounder seeds billionaire political effort amid wealth tax debate
articles.summary: Sergey Brin, a Google cofounder and one of the wealthiest people in the world, is donating $20 million to a new California political drive weeks after he took steps to leave the state to avoid a possible billionaire tax.

articles.title: Saks ending ecommerce partnership with Amazon: Report
articles.summary: Saks will wind down its Saks on Amazon storefront so it can focus on parts of its business it sees as spurring more growth. The partnership arose from Amazon's $475 million investment in Saks' business in 2024. The companies agreed to an arrangement in which Saks would sell products on Amazon, paying the e-commerce giant at least $900 million over eight years.

articles.title: Combining SpaceX with xAI may be simple for Musk, but Tesla isn't so easy
articles.summary: Elon Musk fans and the man himself have long mused about Musk Inc, a merger of companies owned by the world's richest man. But with ‍SpaceX expected to go public later this year, and Tesla facing ​a challenging transition from human-driven EVs to robotaxis and robots, even some proponents of a sprawling Musk conglomerate want to start smaller.

articles.title: SpaceX generated about $8 billion in profit last year ahead of IPO: Report
articles.summary: SpaceX ​generated about $8 billion in profit on $15 billion to $16 billion of revenue ⁠last year, two people familiar with the company's results said, providing fresh insight into the financial health of Elon Musk's space company that is expected to go public later this year.

articles.title: From search to shopping carts, digital ads mint Rs 80,000 crore
articles.summary: Indian tech and ecommerce companies earned close to Rs 80,000 crore in ad revenue in 2024-25. Digital advertising fueled this growth as brands sought measurable results. Google and Meta lead with strong performance. Retail media platforms like Amazon and Flipkart also saw significant gains. This trend highlights a shift in advertising budgets towards data-driven digital channels.

articles.title: Paytm ups focus on consumer payments as profits stabilise, revenues grow
articles.summary: Addressing stock market analysts a day after the company declared its December quarter results, Paytm chief executive Vijay Shekhar Sharma said the company is working on building consumer products. The management is also working on making its stockbroking entity, Paytm Money, among the country’s top five brokers in the next three years.

articles.title: Farm jam: Budget bets on nuts, cocoa, fisheries to boost agri value
articles.summary: India's latest budget places a strong emphasis on high-value agricultural products and supporting industries. This forward-thinking approach not only aims to cut down on imports but also seeks to elevate farmers' earnings and increase export potential.

articles.title: Missed Budget 2026 speech? Watch 10 big highlights that impact comman man's life
Budget 2026 builds confidence but defence misses spotlight: Anant Goenka, President , FICCI
‘Inflation down in India & it’s remaining there for some time’: FM Sitharaman at post-Budget presser
A chatbot entirely powered by humans, not artificial intelligence? This Chilean community shows why
articles.summary: Residents near Santiago, Chile, powered a human chatbot to show AI's environmental impact. The 12-hour project handled over 25,000 requests globally. This initiative aims to highlight the hidden water footprint of AI prompting. It encourages responsible AI use in water-stressed regions. Major tech companies are building data centres in the area, sparking debate over resource consumption.

articles.title: South Korea posts record January exports on AI chip boom
articles.summary: South Korea posted its highest-ever exports for the month of January, official data showed on Sunday, fuelled by a global AI boom heavily reliant on chips made in the country. The record was set a month earlier, when the country exported chips worth $20.8 billion.

articles.title: KKR-led group set to buy Singapore data-centre firm valued at over $10 billion, WSJ reports
articles.summary: A KKR-led group is close to acquiring ST Telemedia Global Data Centres. The deal values the company at over 13 billion Singapore dollars. KKR is partnering with Singtel for this acquisition. This transaction is set to be one of Asia's largest data centre deals. Demand for digital infrastructure is surging due to artificial intelligence growth.

articles.title: AI agents’ social network becomes talk of the town
articles.summary: Moltbook, a new social network for AI agents, has exploded in popularity, attracting around a million bots within hours. Inspired by Reddit, the text-heavy platform lets AI discuss philosophy, stories and even emotions, delighting some researchers. Others warn it is chaotic, filled with crypto promotion and hype.

articles.title: Is ‘AI-washing’ behind new wave of tech layoffs?
articles.summary: Companies are increasingly pointing to artificial intelligence when announcing job cuts, alongside more traditional reasons such as weak finances or overhiring. AI was mentioned in over 50,000 layoffs in 2025, with firms like Amazon, Pinterest and HP linking cuts to future AI-driven changes. Critics warn some companies may be using “AI-washing” to justify cost-driven layoffs.

articles.title: Videogame stocks slide on Google's AI model that turns prompts into playable worlds
articles.summary: Shares of videogame companies fell sharply on Friday after Google launched its AI model, Project Genie, which can create interactive digital worlds from text or images. Take-Two, Roblox, and Unity dropped 9–19% as the technology could disrupt traditional game development. Developers fear faster cycles may cut costs but threaten jobs.

articles.title: Ajit Pawar's memorial to be built in Baramati's Vidya Pratishthan
articles.summary: A memorial for Ajit Pawar will be built at Vidya Pratishthan in Baramati after his fatal plane crash. Sharad Pawar and Pratibha Pawar initiated planning with Kiran Gujar and trustees.

articles.title: Paradip Port breaks monthly high, handles 14.44 million tonnes of cargo in January
articles.summary: Paradip Port Authority has credited sustained infrastructure upgrades, streamlined terminal operations, and stronger stakeholder coordination for achieving its best-ever January performance. The port’s leadership said the milestone reflects workforce efficiency and ongoing modernisation efforts to support India’s expanding trade needs.

articles.title: Blue Star flags possible data breach, engages cybersecurity experts
articles.summary: Blue Star added that the incident came to the attention of its compliance officer on January 31, 2026, at around 10:30 pm, and the disclosure is being made as a matter of good governance.

articles.title: Budget 2026 doubles down on capex push as FM calls it highest in a decade; India Inc cheers
articles.summary: FM Nirmala Sitharaman said capital expenditure in Budget 2026 is the highest in a decade, with a ₹12.2 lakh crore outlay reinforcing the infrastructure-led growth push amid global uncertainty, drawing broad support from industry and economists.

articles.title: No big surprises in Budget 2026, but strong push on infra and defence, say former govt officials
articles.summary: Giridhar Aramane, former Defence Secretary, says Budget 2026’s sharp rise in defence allocation will boost military preparedness and give a strong push to domestic defence manufacturing.

articles.title: Goods and Service Tax collections rose 6.2% to over ₹1.93 lakh crore in January, say sources
articles.summary: Gross Goods and Service Tax collections rose 6.2 percent to over ₹1.93 lakh crore in January, marking an eight-month high, with net GST revenues at ₹1.71 lakh crore.

articles.title: Changes to India's inflation weights explained in three simple points
articles.summary: India’s new CPI series represents a significant structural recalibration in the India's inflation measurement framework, writes Dr. Arun Singh, Global Chief Economist, Dun & Bradstreet.

articles.title: Kolkata fire: Adhikari leads rally, demands arrest of food chain owners
articles.summary: Adhikari alleged that the ruling Trinamool Congress (TMC) was shielding those responsible for the tragedy and showing insensitivity, claiming that Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee had not visited the site even five days after the incident, while rescue and search operations were still underway.

articles.title: Meet Kevin Warsh — The 17th Federal Reserve Chair picked by Donald Trump
articles.summary: Warsh's vast career spans across the private sector and Capitol Hill, as well as senior roles within the Federal Reserve. He studied public policy at Stanford University, with an emphasis on economics and statistics.

articles.title: Top Stories | 10 biggest stories from FM Sitharaman’s record 9th budget

articles.title: Nvidia CEO Huang denies he is unhappy with OpenAI, says 'huge' investment planned
articles.summary: Huang has also privately criticised what he has described as a lack of discipline in OpenAI's business approach and expressed concern about the competition it faces from the likes of Alphabet's GOOGL.O Google and Anthropic, the WSJ said.

articles.title: India government sets deadline for financial bids for IDBI, says report
articles.summary: India sets February 5 deadline for financial bids in IDBI Bank divestment, with Fairfax Financial Holdings, Emirates NBD and Kotak Mahindra Bank approved as bidders for a 60.7% stake sale.

articles.title: Relaxo Footwears Q3 FY26 profit falls 20% to ₹26.5 crore despite stable revenue
articles.summary: Relaxo Footwears posted steady topline performance in the December quarter, supported by strong traction in organised retail, e-commerce, and large-format stores. However, higher expenses weighed on profitability, prompting the company to emphasise a balanced focus on growth and margins going forward.

articles.title: Ashoka Buildcon's net profit jumps over three-fold; revenue falls 23%
articles.summary: Ashoka Buildcon's Q3 profit jumped to ₹2,111.41 crore, despite a 23% revenue drop. Shares of Ashoka Buildcon Ltd ended higher on Friday, January 30, by 3.72% at ₹149.99 on the NSE.

articles.title: Air India AI171 crash probe: AAIB examining aircraft components, ‘nothing ruled out’ yet
articles.summary: Investigators probing the deadly June 2025 Air India Dreamliner crash are continuing a multi-layered assessment of technical systems, cockpit actions, organisational processes and environmental conditions.
